    ModelArray Quick Start An intro to R Developer documentation

    ModelArray

    ModelArray is a generalizable, memory-efficient R package for statistical analysis of fixel data. Its features include:

    • Easy to use: set up your analysis with just several lines of codes;
    • Low memory requirement, even for large datasets;
    • At present, ModelArray supports linear models as well as generalized additive models (GAM) with penalized splines, which are particularly useful for studying nonlinear effects in lifespan data.

    Installation

    Before you install ModelArray R package, if you are using Linux system, please check if libhdf5-dev has been installed in your system:

    foo@bar:~$ ldconfig -p | grep libhdf5*

    If you got more than one line of outputs, congrats, you have libhdf5-dev installed. Otherwise, please install it. For Ubuntu user, you may install via:

    foo@bar:~$ sudo apt-get update -y
foo@bar:~$ sudo apt-get install -y libhdf5-dev

    You can install the latest version from GitHub with:

    # install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("PennLINC/ModelArray")

    How to use

    Load the package into R via:

    library(ModelArray)

    We provide a quick start guide here.
    For documentations of functions, you can either refer to this webpage; Or in R console: help(<function_name>). For example: help(ModelArray.lm)
    For users who are not familiar with R, you may check out this webpage.
    For developers who hope to contribute to our package, you may check out this documentation for developers.
